security: Revealing that John F. Rittenhouse is a semi-covert employee 'integrated into the' and not 'deep cover' could compromise his operational effectiveness. Additionally, disclosing integration into the 'Department of taas' may expose sensitive departmental affiliations.
summary: A memo from the Chief of the Overseas Branch to the Chief of the Special Security Branch canceling John F. Rittenhouse's security clearance, reclassifying him as a semi-covert employee integrated into a department.
summary_one_paragraph: On December 14, 1950, a memo was sent from the Chief of the Overseas Branch, Joseph S. Reff, to the Chief of the Special Security Branch, instructing the cancellation of John F. Rittenhouse's security clearance (dated December 7, 1950). This change indicates that Rittenhouse, also known under the pseudo name OPC #23500, is now considered a semi-covert employee within the 'Department of taas' as of December 13, 1950, and will no longer be categorized as deep cover.
title: John F. RITTENHOUSE (Pseudo - OPC)
